image.altText: A woman and a man dressed formally with awards.

props.synopsis: Melanoma research pioneers Georgina Long and Richard Scolyer are jointly named 2024 Australians of the Year for their work developing an immunotherapy approach to treating melanoma.

title.children: 'We do not let fear hold us back': Melanoma researchers named joint 2024 Australians of the Year

image.altText: A tight shot of Jim Chalmers head, he wears a suit and red tie stands in front of a blue curtain

props.synopsis: While a lot of the political commentary is fixated on Labor's broken promise, will its backflip make the tax system better? On that, there's a lot less argument.

title.children: Labor is taking a six-to-one gamble that money in the pocket is more important than a broken promise

image.altText: cloudy sky and choppy waves and a line of boats docked

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily is moving inland as a tropical low after crossing the Queensland coast overnight leaving more than 50,000 without power.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily moves inland leaving more than 50,000 without power

image.altText: Man with glasses

props.synopsis: One of Australia's richest men Andrew Budzinski faces a class action over allegations that he and his company, IC Markets, misled thousands of everyday investors who may have collectively lost hundreds of millions of dollars trading in risky financial products.

title.children: Investors 'picking up pieces of their life' after rich-lister faces class action alleging he misled them

image.altText: A composite image of Father Bob, Sandra Sully and Fiona Melanie Woods

props.synopsis: This year's Australia Day honours has recognised a variety of Australians from well-known media personalities to those working away behind the scenes.

title.children: Social justice advocates, TV presenters, doctors and scientists among those recognised in Australia Day 2024 Honours

image.altText: three children draped in Australian flags stand near the water

props.synopsis: A mix of rain and sunshine is forecast throughout the country for this weekend's Australia Day long weekend, with extreme weather warnings also in place. Take a look at what the weather bureau forecasts for the next three days.

title.children: Australia Day long weekend weather forecast predicts rain and sunshine around the country

image.altText: Colourful illustration of ocean and land with coral, seaweed, fish, insects, grass and cliff face.

props.synopsis: As Aussies head to the beaches and parklands this summer, we asked a venom expert to rank the top 10 most painful creatures they might encounter.

title.children: From a bull ant bite to the 'physical torture' of the irukandji, we asked an expert to rank Australia's most painful creatures

image.altText: A group of people, including Indigenous, gathered around a smoking ceremony in a clearing, trees around it.

props.synopsis: Dawn services are a way for people to pay their respects to the Aboriginal people who were killed during the business of settling Australia, and acknowledge the ongoing impacts of colonisation on First Nations people.

title.children: January 26 is a day of mourning for Aboriginal people. Dawn services help honour that

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka plays a backhand return at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Having spent a lot of time reflecting on her loss to Coco Gauff in last year's US Open decider, Aryna Sabalenka reveals what was behind her straight-sets win over the American in the semifinals at Melbourne Park.

title.children: How Aryna Sabalenka got 'revenge' against Coco Gauff to keep Australian Open defence alive

image.altText: The side of a house with an air conditioning unit and an awning pulled down over the window on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: As the mercury rises, you may be looking for some cost-effective ways to cool your home. Here's how to lower your energy bill without sacrificing comfort.

title.children: Blasting your aircon at 21 degrees Celsius to beat the heat? Here's the cost-effective temperature experts recommend

image.altText: Russian plane

props.synopsis: Russia and Ukraine trade accusations over the crash of a military transport plane that Moscow says was carrying Ukrainian prisoners of war and was shot down by Kyiv's forces, another heated episode in the information war that has been a feature of the conflict.

title.children: Ukraine and Russia trade accusations over fatal plane crash that Moscow says involved Ukrainian POWs

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A soccer player wearing yellow and green kicks the ball while his team-mates and opposition wearing all blue run behind him

props.synopsis: They may have won their group, but the Socceroos rode their luck to the Asian Cup knockouts. They'll need much more than that if they're to win the whole thing, writes Samantha Lewis.

title.children: Can the Socceroos create their own luck to challenge for Asian Cup title?

image.altText: A police officer stands in front of a house in remote NT, decorated in Christmas items

props.synopsis: Jared Porch is serving a four-year-and-nine-month jail sentence with a non-parole period of 18 months, after pleading guilty to grooming men and offering them money in exchange for sexually explicit videos that included children.

title.children: NT Supreme Court dismisses appeal to increase former cop's jail sentence

image.altText: Igor Girkin, a former Russian military chief sits in a glass cage in a Moscow courtroom.

props.synopsis: Prominent Russian nationalist Igor Girkin was convicted by a Moscow court on Thursday of inciting extremism and jailed for four years.

title.children: Prominent Russian nationalist Igor Girkin, involved in MH17 shooting, jailed for four years over 'extremism'

image.altText: Woman stands in glass cell looking defiant

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old was arrested after being seen in a video presenting the prominent war blogger with a bust of himself, moments before the explosion at a riverside cafe.

title.children: Woman sentenced to 27 years after St Petersburg cafe bombing which killed military blogger

image.altText: A middle-aged Indigenous woman looks at the camera with a slight smile, long black hair, lavender patterned blouse.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says the quiet appointment of Central Australia's regional controller to a second position will not hinder her search for solutions to the crime crisis.

title.children: Public servant tasked to address Alice Springs' crime issues given another job, government says can do both

image.altText: a screen shows a calculator that can assist people to understand how tax cuts will affect them.

props.synopsis: Want to know how the federal government's planned changes to the final stage of tax cuts will affect you? Use our tax cut calculator to find out.

title.children: Stage 3 tax cuts calculator: See how the changes will affect you

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: The prime minister has defended changes to the stage 3 tax cuts, saying the government made its decision to overhaul the system as a way to ease cost-of-living pressures on Australians.

title.children: Could the crossbench and the Coalition stand in the way of Albanese's tax cut overhaul?

image.altText: A sign for Woolworths on top of another for Coles

props.synopsis: The ACCC can't change the prices supermarkets charge. But it can take them to court if they're breaking the laws in the Competition and Consumer Act.

title.children: The ACCC is going to investigate supermarket prices. Here's what the watchdog can and can't do

image.altText: Boating equipment is stacked up on a Townsville beach

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Kirrily's irregular shape will alter hazards to the north and south as it nears the north Queensland coastline.

title.children: Cyclone Kirrily is not your usual cyclone. This is why it's different

image.altText: An aerial shot of a paddock with a huge map of Australia tilled into it.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmer Harrison Schuster has dedicated 60 hectares of his land to paying tribute to the nation.

title.children: 'Puts us on the map': Farmer tills giant tribute to Australia into paddock

image.altText: There are three people in the photo. Uncle John, Nikki Foy and Jacob Morris

props.synopsis: What does January 26 mean to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people?  For many, there isn’t one emotion that fully captures it.

title.children: This January 26, Indigenous Australians are feeling strong emotions of love, respect, sadness and hope

image.altText: Qinwen Zheng shouts after winning her Australian Open semifinal.

props.synopsis: Twelfth seed Qinwen Zheng takes down Ukrainian qualifier Dayana Yastremska to reach the Australian Open final where she will face reigning champion Aryna Sabalenka, who beat Coco Gauff in straight sets in their semifinal.

title.children: Qinwen Zheng sets up Australian Open final against defending champion Aryna Sabalenka

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a red shirt

props.synopsis: The federal government's move to halve the stage 3 tax cuts for higher earners and instead prioritise relief across the board has been described as both "good government" and an "unbelievable" broken promise.

title.children: We went to Albanese's Sydney electorate for reaction to his tax cuts. Here's what people think

image.altText: The Australian, Aboriginal and Torres Strait flags fly in Canberra.

props.synopsis: A shire president in regional WA says her council is under pressure to appease two sides of the debate around changing the date of Australia Day events, and wants more guidance from the federal government.

title.children: Country councils want federal government to make decision on Australia Day date as debate rages

image.altText: Cameron Green stands on his own

props.synopsis: Usman Khawaja was handed an ICC accolade, while Cameron Green had to stand alone on day one of the second Test between Australia and West Indies at the Gabba. Here's the five quick hits.

title.children: Five quick hits — Green isolated, Windies defiant, Khawaja honoured on day one

image.altText: Purple and yellow lights on the horizon from the top of a mountain.

props.synopsis: The official space weather alert wording is careful and contains no guarantees, but veteran aurora australis hunter Margaret Sonneman says things are looking good for a cosmic light show worth staying up for.

title.children: Hopes high for aurora australis sky show for Southern Lights enthusiasts

image.altText: People getting off a seaplane in the ocean

props.synopsis: NSW Police says one of the eight occupants had minor injuries and was treated at the scene by NSW Ambulance paramedics.

title.children: 'Could have been worse': Passengers escape after seaplane crashes into Sydney Harbour

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A man pushes away a television camera.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide magistrate dismisses a prosecution application to revoke home detention bail for Raelene Polymiadis, who is accused of murdering her elderly parents by injecting them with her own insulin.

title.children: Raelene Polymiadis's husband shoves media outside court following bail hearing

image.altText: A sign that says "Welcome to Birdsville" standing on the side of an outback highway.

props.synopsis: Birdsville locals say stepping outside is like standing in front of an open oven. An elder says he's seen crows falling from trees amid the near unbearable conditions, but the BOM says relief is on the way.

title.children: Queensland records its hottest January day on record as mercury nears 50C in outback town

image.altText: The WA Premier Roger Cook in a suit jacket and business shirt crossing the street in Kalgoorlie-Boulder

props.synopsis: Power is today expected to be restored to the final 80 Western Power customers affected by last week's blackouts as the WA Premier promises Kalgoorlie-Boulder's power supply will be "more reliable" in the future.

title.children: State government to replace aging Kalgoorlie power generators after regional WA blackout

image.altText: public housing towers can be seen from the aerial view

props.synopsis: Residents at Victoria's public housing towers have filed a class action over the state governments plan to knock down and rebuild the structures.

title.children: Residents sue the Victorian government over public housing demolition plans

image.altText: A man with scarring on his face wearing a surgical mask is carried on a stretcher.

props.synopsis: Shinji Aoba stormed into Kyoto Animation and set it on fire, killing 36 people and leaving more than 30 others burned and injured because he thought the famous anime studio had ripped off some of his work.

title.children: Death sentence for man who torched Japanese anime studio he claimed stole his ideas, killing 36 people

image.altText: A bed with straps inside an execution chamber

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court denies convicted murderer Kenneth Smith's request to stay his execution by nitrogen gas, the nation's first execution using the method which is scheduled for Thursday.

title.children: Court declines to halt first execution by nitrogen gas of inmate in Alabama

image.altText: The bronze feet of a vandalised statue.

props.synopsis: Police in Melbourne investigate after a metal statue of Captain Cook was sawn off at the ankles and red paint was daubed over a monument to Queen Victoria.

title.children: Melbourne Captain Cook statue sawn off at ankles, Queen Victoria monument defaced
